subject: p14387068
History: -year-old man with hepatic hydrothorax, now status post right-sided pigtail placement, evaluate for pneumothorax.
Findings: There is a new right pigtail catheter in the right lower hemithorax. The large right hydropneumothorax appears essentially unchanged from the prior exam within the limitations of technique. Bilateral hazy opacification is suggestive of mild pulmonary edema. Focal opacity in left upper lobe is consistent with pneumonia and similar to the prior study. NG tube is seen terminating in the stomach. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable.
Impression: New right pigtail catheter. No evidence for significant change in right hydropneumothorax. Focal opacity in left upper lobe, most likely pneumonia. Findings suggesting mild pulmonary vascular congestion.
